page.title: 15Brackenhurst
page.content: The first house at{Brackenhurst}was built in 1828 and it was built by{ {Thomas Coates Cane.}His grandson was Field Marshall Allenby and Allenby Road in Southwell was named after him. The owners of Brackenhurst Hall bought more land around the hall over the years. At Brackenhurst now there are some{bulls}called{Charvale-Norman, {Glenstor}and{Brightstar.}There is a herd of{Fresian cows,}they are good for milking,some{sheep,}some{pigs}that are{fattened}up for{bacon}and some {beef cattle.}Brackenhurst Hall is now a College of Agriculture.Sometimes the {college gardens}open up for viewers to look around.Brackenhurst may once have been called{Brockenhurst.}That means a place where{badgers}settle. {Brackenhurst}means a hill with {bracken.}No bracken can grow as the ground is clay.
